name: HD 86264
scenarioDescription:
The HD 86264 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 86264 is a star with 1.42 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.88 times its radius. It is located 221.59 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.24 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 86264 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 86264 system


HD 86264 b

HD 86264 b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.86 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 86264 b is 2226 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 86264 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 86264, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Lick Observatory.
